ds.board.ds.legend.other: Fontes de dados são locais de armazenamento concretos que são agregados pelo Pydio em uma árvore global. Eles podem ser distribuídos entre muitos nós de armazenamento conforme necessário.

ds.board.enc.legend.other: Chaves mestres são geradas automaticamente pelo serviço Pydio e armazenadas no servidor protegido. Use as ferramentas abaixo para exportar/importar essas chaves caso precise reinstalar ou implantar em outro servidor

ds.board.versioning.legend.other: Você pode definir como os arquivos serão versionados para cada fonte de dados e quantas versões a aplicação manterá ao longo do tempo.

ds.board.wsfromds.legend.other: Criar um novo espaço de trabalho na raiz do código de dados %s

ds.format-picker.legend.other: DataSources are mount points allowing you to attach actual storage to the application. First select the way data is organized inside storage.

ds.format-picker.flat.legend.other: Best for performances, files are stored as binaries inside the storage. Files and folders structure is kept in internal index only.

ds.format-picker.structured.legend.other: Files and folders are stored as-is, real-time synchronisation reflects storage structure inside internal indexes.

ds.format-picker.internal.legend.other: Used to store internal binaries (e.g. files versions, thumbnails). Limited features, data is not indexed in search engines.

ds.editor.delete.warning.other: Tem certeza que deseja excluir esta informação? Isso não pode ser desfeito, e você pode perder todos os dados vinculados a estes nós!

ds.editor.enc.dialog.disable.other: Se você habilitou a criptografia anteriormente nesta fonte de dados, todos os dados criptografados ficarão Ilegíveis! Você tem certeza que deseja fazer isso?

ds.editor.enc.dialog.enable.1.other: Habilitar a criptografia em fonte de dados começará a cifrar os dados no armazenamento usando a chave de criptografia que você fornecer.

ds.editor.enc.dialog.enable.2.other: Por favor, esteja ciente de que se você não exportar e fazer backup da sua chave mestra e se você tiver que reinstalar o servidor por qualquer motivo,

ds.editor.enc.dialog.enable.3.other: Você também deve estar ciente de que pode exigir mais CPU para uma criptografia / descriptografia rápida e sem problemas dos dados.

ds.editor.enc.dialog.enable.create.other: Definir um identificador para a nova chave

ds.editor.enc.key.create.other: Configurar criptografia com uma nova chave...

ds.editor.legend.delete.1.other: A exclusão da fonte de dados é uma operação destrutiva: embora ela NÃO remova os dados dentro do armazenamento subjacente, ele irá destruir o índice existente e desvincular todos os ACLs ligados aos nós indexados.

ds.editor.legend.delete.2.other: Certifique-se de primeiro remover todos os espaços de trabalho que estão apontando para esta fonte de dados antes de excluí-lo.

ds.editor.legend.local.other: Os arquivos do sistema de dados servem arquivos através de um servidor de armazenamento de objeto, que está iniciando na pasta pai e servindo o alvo como um bucket s3. Por esta razão, a pasta selecionada deve atender aos seguintes requisitos:

ds.editor.legend.local.li.1.other: Pelo menos dois níveis de profundidade.

ds.editor.legend.local.li.2.other: A pasta pai deve ter permissão de escrita pelo usuário do serviço da aplicação

ds.editor.legend.local.li.3.other: A pasta de destino deve obedecer aos nomes de DNS (letras minúsculas, sem espaços ou caracteres especiais).

ds.editor.legend.resync.other: A sincronização irá verificar o armazenamento subjacente e detectar alterações que não estão indexadas no momento.

ds.editor.legend.s3.1.other: Os recursos de dados de armazenamento remoto servirão arquivos de um armazenamento remoto compatível com s3-ao proxying de todas as requisições.

ds.editor.legend.s3.2.other: Use a chave de API padrão / Api Secret para autenticar, deixe a URL do endpoint em branco para AmazonS3 ou use a URL de armazenamento para outras soluções locais.

ds.editor.storage.legend.fs.other: Procurar dados de um sistema de arquivos local ou arquivos na sua rede.

ds.editor.storage.legend.fs.peer.other: Restringir a fonte de dados para um endereço de par irá iniciar o serviço apenas um nó específico. Usar o valor "qualquer" iniciará o serviço em todos os nós onde as células são executadas, que pode ser útil se um sistema de arquivos compartilhado é montado em todos os nós no mesmo local, ou se o nó pode alterar seu IP ao reiniciar. Para evitar conflitos, é melhor ou usar QUALQUER uma fonte de dados ou selecionar nós específicos para todos os dados.

ds.editor.storage.legend.fs.path.other: Certifique-se de que a última pasta esteja em letras minúsculas e de que o pai esteja editável. Se sua pasta existente for caso positivo, você pode usar links simbólicos para contornar essa limitação.

ds.editor.storage.legend.s3.other: Procurar dados de um repositório Amazon S3 ou de um armazenamento compatível com S3.

ds.editor.storage.legend.azure.other: Procurar dados de um grupo de armazenamento do Azure Blob.

ds.editor.storage.legend.gcs.other: Procurar dados de um grupo de armazenamento da Google Cloud.

ds.editor.storage.legend.versioning.other: Configurar política de versionamento para manter o histórico de modificações de conteúdo dos arquivos. Cuidado com o fato de que usará espaço de armazenamento adicional.

ds.editor.storage.legend.encryption.other: Criptografia em rest pode ser usada para garantir que os arquivos nunca sejam armazenados em formato limpo dentro do armazenamento. Isso pode ser útil se você não confiar no provedor do armazenamento.

ds.editor.storage.legend.readOnly.other: Use o modo somente leitura se desejar que o Cells nunca grave nenhum arquivo oculto e use eTags nativos como somas de verificação (isso pode ser necessário para depósitos com grande quantidade de dados existentes). No entanto, observe que qualquer espaço de trabalho criado nesta fonte de dados deve ser definido como Somente leitura, pois o recurso de mover pode não funcionar corretamente.

ds.editor.storage.flatStorage.other: Manter estrutura de dados no armazenamento

ds.editor.storage.legend.flatStorage.other: O armazenamento plano (não estruturado) é o melhor para desempenhos. Use armazenamento estruturado somente se você deseja ter certeza de que os arquivos e pastas reproduzidos dentro do armazenamento real (ou mapear para uma pasta com dados pré-existentes). Esta opção NÃO pode ser alterada após a criação de código de dados.

ds.editor.storage.legend.skipResync.other: For huge datasources, you may want to avoid full resynchronisation at restart time.

ds.editor.storage.nativeEtags.other: Usar Etags Nativas (desativará a Sincronização do Desktop)

ds.editor.storage.legend.checksumMapper.other: Para a detecção adequada de alterações, as somas de verificação de arquivos (md5) são calculadas por Cells (ou pelo armazenamento com uma cópia local, quando possível) e anexadas como metadados aos objetos. Para obter melhores desempenhos, use o sinalizador Native ETags para manter os valores originais do armazenamento, mas tome cuidado, pois isso desativará a sincronização da área de trabalho nesta fonte de dados. Você também pode simplesmente impedir a modificação de objetos, enquanto ainda calcula somas de verificação, armazenando metadados localmente.

ds.editor.name.inuse.other: Esse nome já está em uso, por favor escolha outro.

ds.editor.selector.completer.hint.other: Escolha da lista ou digite um caminho e pressione Enter

ds.editor.selector.error.depth.other: Certifique-se de selecionar uma pasta profunda com dois níveis. O armazenamento de objeto será iniciado na pasta pai.

ds.editor.selector.error.dnsname.other: A pasta é exposta como um repositório S3 e deve obedecer aos nomes DNS (minúsculas, sem espaço ou caracteres especiais).

ds.editor.selector.folder.hint.other: Selecione um par para carregar pastas

ds.editor.selector.peer.any.other: Qualquer parceiro (nó único ou distribuído FS)

ds.editor.storage.gcs.credentials.other: Colar conteúdo do arquivo de credenciais do GCS JSON

ds.editor.storage.buckets.cont.nokeys.other: Configurar o armazenamento para carregar repositórios

ds.editor.storage.s3.legend.tags.other: Sincronize etiquetas S3 de repositórios ou objetos (use uma lista de padrões separados por vírgulas para corresponder). Por favor, note que isto irá executar solicitações adicionais para armazenamento e pode diminuir o processo de sincronização. As tags originais serão mapeadas para pydio:s3-bucket-tag-NAME e pydio:s3-object-tag-NAME internamente.

ds.editor.storage.s3.legend.bucketPathPr.other: Use a path prefix inside the bucket (will create a virtual folder to store objects)

ds.editor.storage.s3.legend.storageClass.other: Custom Storage Class (leave empty to use STANDARD). Amazon S3 supports the following values: REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, GLACIER, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR. Beware that using GLACIER or equivalent will make the datasource write-only, as objects have to be manually restored before being available for download.

ds.editor.initFlatFromSnapshot.other: If this storage was previously used as a flat datasource, initialize it from an existing snapshot file (must be found inside the storage)

ds.editor.foldersShardingPattern.other: By default, all files are stored inside a unique folder. Use a pattern 'N:P:Q' to auto-create sub folders id[:N]/id[:P]/id[:Q]/...

ds.encryption.key.delete.warning.other: Se a chave for usada atualmente para dados criptografados, esta é uma operação muito destrutiva! Você tem certeza que quer fazer isso?

ds.encryption.key.export.fail.other: Algo deu errado durante a exportação

ds.encryption.key.export.password.other: Por favor, forneça uma senha mais forte.

ds.encryption.key.export.result.copy.other: Copiar resultado para um arquivo para salvar a chave

ds.encryption.key.import.content.other: Cole a chave aqui do seu arquivo de backup

ds.encryption.key.import.fail.other: Algo deu errado durante a importação

ds.encryption.key.import.password.other: Use senha no momento da exportação

ds.encryption.key.import.success.other: A chave foi importada com sucesso

ds.emptyState.other: Nenhuma fonte de dados criada ainda

logs.export.disabled.other: Escolha uma data ou filtro de resultado

logs.sys.note.content.other: Entradas de logs vazias podem significar que o servidor não está sendo executado em modo de produção. Certifique-se de definir esse nível de log passando o argumento de produção --log=ou definindo a variável de ambiente PYDIO_LOGS_LEVEL=production.

logs.4.other: Clique em uma linha para detalhes

logs.9.other: O arquivo será exportado como formato CSV com separadores semi-colmuns (;) e campos colocados em aspas duplas (").

menu.10.other: Extensões para o envio de arquivos através da interface da Web

menu.15.other: Como os usuários recebem notificações de várias partes da aplicação.

menu.17.other: Mensagens instantâneas e uma ferramenta externa de aceleração

menu.23.other: Página inicial para o usuário após o login. Configure elementos exibidos e links.

menu.6.other: Opções para todos os arquivos e compartilhamento de pastas

menu.8.other: Ativar/desativar editores e gerenciar seus parâmetros

metadata.delete.confirm.other: Você deseja realmente excluir este metadado?

metadata.editor.label.error.other: Campo de metadados não pode estar vazia

metadata.editor.ns.error.other: Escolha um namespace para este metadados

metadata.editor.ns.exists.other: Este nome já existe, por favor, escolha outro

metadata.namespaces.legend.other: Os metadados podem ser anexados a qualquer arquivo ou pasta dos usuários. Você pode definir aqui o tipo de metadados que deseja exibir, e se cada meta é legível/gravável pelos usuários padrão, em oposição aos usuários administradores.

metadata.group-field.other: Group Name (creates an expandable section). Use '/' for sub-groups.

perfs.booster.description.other: Verifica se Pydio Booster é iniciado e permite a comunicação de WebSocket

perfs.booster.error.other: Erro de Pydio Booster, veja o painel dedicado

perfs.booster.help.other: Pydio Booster fornece uma ferramenta adicional fácil de implantar para adicionar suporte a WebSocket e fazer Upload/Download no Pydio.

perfs.cache.description.other: Checks that a Pydio is configured to use a cache layer

perfs.cache.error.other: It does not seem that you have activated the cache service.

perfs.cache.help.other: Pydio can connect to an external cache server like Redis or Memcache, or use in-memory cache to greatly improve file browsing performances.

perfs.cli.description.other: Defer time-consuming tasks to command line.

perfs.cli.error.other: Warning, command line is not enabled!

perfs.cli.help.other: Enable the command line in core parameters. This will greatly improve end-user performances, as time-consuming tasks are delegated to other processes.

perfs.debug.description.other: Checks if debug modes are disabled on the server

perfs.debug.error.other: Warning, one of PYDIO_SERVER_DEBUG, PYDIO_CLIENT_DEBUG or PYDIO_SKIP_CACHE is set to True!

perfs.debug.help.other: Make sure to disable debug modes on the server. This is done manually by editing the conf/booststrap_context.php (or /etc/pydio/bootstrap_context.php) file.

perfs.desc.other: Checking system configurations for possible improvements.

perfs.load.description.other: Detect high server load (Linux servers only)

perfs.load.error.other: Maybe adding some CPU or RAM to your server could be neccessary.

perfs.load.help.other: A high server load may indicate that your server is missing CPU or RAM given your usage of Pydio.

perfs.mailer.description.other: Checks that mailer is using the Queue feature

perfs.mailer.error.other: Mailer is not configured to defer emails sending.

perfs.mailer.help.other: Using the mail queue avoids sending every emails directly during every actions and requests, but store them in a separate database and process the queue separately.

perfs.opcache.description.other: Checks that a PHP Opcode cache is active

perfs.opcache.error.other: Could not detect any php extension from APC, APCu, Opcache or XCache.

perfs.opcache.help.other: Pydio is a rich PHP framework that requires loading a lot of files in memory. Make sure to enable a PHP Opcache like APC/u, Opcache or XCache.

plugins.4.other:
Editor plugins are the previewers/editors associated to any file types in the application.
                    These plugins are handle specifically in the GUI (extensions) and can declare the mimetypes they support.
                    The order parameter also allows to define a priority for the 'open with...' action.

policies.policy.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you want to delete this policy? Make sure it does not break the security of the application!

policies.rule.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you want to remove this security rule? This could break the security model of the application!

policies.type.acl.legend.other: These policies are used to dynamically provide read/write access to workspaces or nodes based on the request context and/or the node metadata. They are defined here and used in the Access Control Panel of the users and roles.

policies.type.oidc.legend.other: OpenId Connect Service is used for authentication of the user, before any access to the APIs. As such, you can totally disable the login operation for a set of users based on the requests context, e.g. disable loging from a given set of IP or at a given time.

policies.type.rest.legend.other: These policies are protecting the REST APIs on a per-uri / per-method basis. They grant basic access to some specific APIs for public discovery, and a restriction access to many APIs to make sure they are accessed only by frontend application. You should generally not touch these unless you know exactly what you do.

react.8.other:
You are about to manage permissions at the lower level. This folder will be read
                        only by default, and you will manage permissions selectively on its children. Choose
                        whether to copy the current permissions to its children, or to clear their permissions, which would make
                        them inaccessible by default.

react.9.other:
You are about to disable the permissions management at the sub-level: all
                        children will automatically inherit this folder permissions, and you current settings
                        for these children will be lost. Are you sure to confirm ?

scheduler.1.other: Scheduler is used to trigger tasks automatically on a regular basis. It requires the launch of a master command regularly: if you are using Pydio Booster, it should trigger this for you. Otherwise, use a CRON to launch master command every minute.

scheduler.2.other: Command-line is not enabled in the %1, the scheduler will not be able to run the jobs.

user.17.empty.other: Please provide a label for this group

user.18.empty.other: Please provide a label for this role

user.20.other: User will be created in group %s

user.8.other: Set parameters on this group to apply them all groups and users.

user.moveto.hint.other: Select destination group, leave '/' for root group.

versions.editor.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you want to delete this policy? This is undoable!

versions.editor.error.lastdelete.other: The last period is configured to delete all versions, you cannot add a new one!

virtual.legend.1.other: Template Paths are dynamically computed depending on the context. They can be used as roots for workspaces in replacement of a fixed datasource path.     They are used by default to create the Personal Files workspace that points to a different folder for each users, and for computing the location of the users Cells folders.

virtual.legend.2.other: Use Ctrl+Space inside the editor to get hint about the possible values. Current values supported are: User.Name (dynamically resolved to the current user logged login) and DataSources (to pick a datasource dynamically).

virtual.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you wish to delete this template path? Operation is not reversible!

virtual.card.cleanOnDelete.other: Upon user deletion, rename data to {deleted-NAME-UUID}.

virtual.card.cleanOnDelete-legend-off.other: This option should not be used if the template path is not creating a folder for each user (using User.Name).

virtual.card.cleanOnDelete-legend-on.other: This option may be recommended as the template path seems to create a folder for each user (using User.Name).

ws.43.other:
Specify here the default access permissions to this workspace folders.
                                To enable the permissions management at a sub-level, select the 'CHILDREN' on a given folder.
                                This will set the current folder as readonly by default, and you will be able to open accesses
                                selectively to any of its children folders.

ws.44.other:
Please be aware that this is only a mask: if you modify the real folders directly, you may have
                                to edit this mask accordingly. Also, these permissions may be globally limited by the 'Default Rights'
                                parameter set for this workspace (see the General tab).

ws.45.other:
As its parameters are using 'PYDIO_USER' or 'PYDIO_GROUP_*' keywords, the contents of
                                this workspace will vary depending on the currently authenticated user. For this reason, you cannot browse the
                                folders directly and assign permissions to them, but you can freely define some generic paths that will be used as masks.

ws.48.other: Beware, this workspace/template is not editable, as it is defined directly in the conf/bootstrap_repositories.php file.

ws.51.other:
This workspace has an indexer (%s). Normally, indexation is done "on-the-fly" when files are added/removed
                    through the application interfaces. However if you are doing some modifications directly at the storage level, you may have
                    to manually re-trigger an indexation from time to time. Use buttons below to either index now, or program a task in the scheduler
                    to run indexation on a regular basis.

ws.52.other: Please note: as this worksace has user-specific contents, indexation will be launched for each user.

ws.56.other:
This workspace has a "purge" setup, to automatically remove documents that were left untouched since %s days. Make sure to add a task in the
                    scheduler to regularly process this workspace and look for expired document. You can use the buttons below to create this task automatically,
                    ok run the purge directly.

ws.57.other: Please note: as this worksace has user-specific contents, purge will be running for each user.

ws.61.other:
Activity of the workspace is displayed to the users in the right-hand panel. You can clear all activity
                            for this workspace, which can be handy e.g. if you are going "live" in production after a staging period where you have
                            made some tests in this workspace.

ws.63.other: Warning, this will clear all activity of this workspace displayed to users. Are you sure you want to do that?

ws.72.other: Fill in the form on the right

ws.74.other: Use the form on the right to create a new DataSource.

ws.75.other: A DataSource defines where your data is stored.

ws.76.other: Pydio will aggregate all your datasources into one master tree, on which you can assign rights using workspaces.

ws.complete.label.other: Select a folder or a predefined template path

ws.dashboard.other: Workspaces define the main access point to your data for the users. Make sure to define at least one datasource to be able to create a workspace that will point to a path of this datasource.

ws.editor.data.legend.other: Workspace exposes one or many 'roots' to the users: choose one or more paths from any DataSource or a Template Path that will be resolved automatically at runtime.

ws.editor.default_rights.other: Set up default permissions to this workspace (applied to all internal users of the application). You can override these permissions on a per-user / per-role / per-group basis in the People section.

ws.editor.help.1.other: Workspaces grant accesses to your data to the users. They expose one or many folders picked inside your datasources.

ws.editor.help.2.other: It is important to properly organize how data will be presented to your users. You may create workspaces for various parts of your organization (finance, marketing, technical data, etc.), on a per-project basis, etc. You can then assign accesses to workspaces on a per-user / per-role / per-group basis.

ws.editor.help.delete.other: Warning, dangerous operation! This is not reversible.

ws.editor.options.legend.other: Label and description are displayed to the users. Choose a self-explanatory name to help users better organize the data.

ws.editor.other.skiprecycle.legend.other: Disable recycle bin on this workspace: all files will be permanently deleted. This does not apply to Cells created inside this workspace, files will always be moved to workspace recycle to avoid human errors.

ws.editor.other.sync.legend.other: Desktop synchronisation allows users to synchronize their files offline on their computer. Warning, this feature is currently supported for personal files only, as shared workspaces may create conflicts if many users synchronize docs in the same folder. For personal files, you can also enable/disable this feature on a per-role basis using Security Policies.

ws.editor.sync.warning.enable.other: Enabling sync on shared workspaces may have unexpected results if many users are syncing and editing files together. Please note that THIS FEATURE IS CURRENTLY NOT SUPPORTED by our professional services. Please use this feature at your own risk!

ws.editor.sync.warning.disable.other: If people are connected to this workspace, their sync task will not be working any more! Are you sure you want to change that?

ws.editor.other.quota.other: Disk Usage Quota (leave 0 for no limit). This quota is computed on all files of this workspace (or user-specific contents for workspaces like Personal Files).

ws.editor.slug.legend.other: Technical name used for example in URLs, automatically computed but you can customize it.

services.tag.gateway.description.other: World-facing services for accessing the platform

services.tag.datasource.description.other: Storage endpoints used to access concrete file storages. Main services are in charge of starting sub services (per datasource).

services.tag.idm.description.other: All services related to authentication and authorizations, roles, security policies, etc.

services.tag.scheduler.description.other: Services for managing background jobs. The task server can be dispatched across various peers.

services.tag.broker.description.other: Services dispatching and processing events (generally toward users) across the application.

services.tag.frontend.description.other: Web services for user interfaces in the browser

services.tag.discovery.description.other: Basic configurations and services registries called by all other services.

services.service.datasource.objects.lege.other: S3 layer to serve data as object storage

services.service.datasource.legend.other: Datasource is synchronizing data from objects layer to index DB.

scheduler.legend.other: Flows running in background on a periodical basis or triggered by events

scheduler.system.legend.other: These Flows are registered by default inside the application. They are generally in charge of extracting information from node in background, or doing some cleaning operations.

scheduler.inactives.legend.other: These Flows are inactive, click on a Flow to enable it.

scheduler.users.legend.other: These Flows are dynamically created and trigged by user actions.

scheduler.cellsflows.cta.text.other: Do you need to create your own Flow? Discover how Cells Flows makes it easy to automate your repetitive manual tasks in Cells.

scheduler.cellsflows.dialog.text.other: From creating your own workflows to scheduling tasks or integrating with third-party tools, our customizable components help you to respond events and take action automatically.

scheduler.job.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you want to delete this Flow? This operation cannot be reverted!

scheduler.tasks.delete.confirm.other: Are you sure you want to clear all tasks for this Flow?

developer.rest.apis.legend.other: Below are all APIs available in Pydio Cells. To consume these APIs, you first have to authenticate against the OpenIDConnect service to get a valid JWT. See the online administrator guide to learn more.

mailer.test.legend.other: Make sure to save your configuration changes before sending a test email.

sites.details.other:
Sites define how Cells is binding to network interfaces and how it is exposed to the outside world. Use ‘./cells configure sites’ to manage your sites from the command line.

Each site has the following parameters:
  1. 1. Bind(s): one or more [ip/hostname:port] to hook the internal webserver to.
  2. 2. TLS Settings: TLS configuration for HTTPS support.
  3. 3. External URL: the URL you communicate to your end-users. It can differ from your bind address, typically if the app is behind a reverse-proxy or inside a container with ports mapping.
  4. 4. Maintenance Mode [On|Off]: display a maintenance page on this endpoint, although Cells is running.

sites.details.note.other:
Additional notes
  1. 1. When there are no sites defined, Cells use a default configuration (https://0.0.0.0:8080 with self-signed).
  2. 2. Sites can be overridden at runtime by using ‘--bind’ flag or ‘CELLS_BIND’ environment variable.

sites.externals.details.other:
Cells uses its detected public URL in some features. It will try to use the most appropriate value based on your configuration.

For example:
  • • If a unique site is defined and it has an external URL, that one is probably correct.
  • • When multiple sites are defined, you may want to force a unique URL that will be used for all external communication.
  • • If no external URL is detected, it will fallback to the internal bind address. In that case, you probably do not want to send a private IP (or 0.0.0.0:port…) to the outside world.

The fields below show the detected values. Select to edit or type in a custom value and hit enter to save.

sites.mailer.url.other: URL used to build links in emails

sites.links.url.other: URL used to build public links

sites.configs.command.other: Use './cells config sites' command to edit sites.
